thread.title: AREA ROUNDUP: Pal-Mac girls tennis wins Class B title
thread.title_full: AREA ROUNDUP: Pal-Mac girls tennis wins Class B title

author: Messenger Post sports@messengerpostmedia.com
title: AREA ROUNDUP: Pal-Mac girls tennis wins Class B title
text: Posted Oct. 7, 2015 at 10:36 PM By Messenger Post Posted Oct. 7, 2015 at 10:36 PM Canandaigua, N.Y. PITTSFORD — The Pal-Mac girls tennis team defeated Batavia 4-1 to capture the Class B championship on Wednesday. The Red Raiders finished the season with a 14-0 record. “It’s very exciting for the team,” Pal-Mac coach Tane Robinson said. “Last year we won the league title and then lost in sectional finals. The girls were hungry to get back there and the hard work paid off.” Erin Graham (6-4, 6-3) and Cara Graham (6-1, 6-1) each won in singles play for Pal-Mac. The Red Raiders first doubles team of Anna O’Donnell and Marietta Koeberle won 7-6(4), 6-1 and its second doubles team of Michaela Darbyshire and Molly Durkin won 6-0, 6-2. “It was neat to see Erin finish her career like that,” Robinson said. “I’m proud of all the girls and it was great to come back into town with the Pal-Mac fire department leading the way.” In other high school girls tennis action on Wednesday: CLASS A SEMIFINALS Pittsford Mendon 7, Canandaigua 0 Tami Collins (0-6, 0-6) won in first singles and Sapna Ramesh and Stephanie Lee won in second doubles to lead Pittsford. CLASS AA SEMIFINALS Victor 4, Webster Thomas 3 Emily Stanley won in first singles for the Blue Devils 6-3, 6-2. Victor’s first doubles team of Sarah Newton and Brenna Marine won 6-1, 6-1, its second doubles team of Kylie Seiler and Allie Perine won 6-4, 6-1 and its third doubles team of Kiara Kolaczyk and Nicole Campbell won 6-1, 6-3. Victor will play Webster Schroeder in the finals on Thursday. BOYS SOCCER Canandaigua 1, Pittsford Mendon 0 Jonathon Brown scored the game winner with a little under 20 minutes left in the second half and was assisted by Roger Panara. Jarret McWilliams made seven saves to notch his sixth shutout of the season. Canandaigua (9-3-1) hosts Irondequoit at 6:30 p.m. on Friday. GIRLS SOCCER Red Jacket 4, Honeoye 1 Sara VanAken scored two goals and had an assist for the Indians. Red Jacket’s X’ayvianna Johnson and Isabelle Porter had a goal and an assist each. Olivia Spencer recorded the shutout for Red Jacket (3-9) and Honeoye’s Emily Kleiner scored the only goal of the game for the Bulldogs. HAC 3, Romulus 2 Juliana Stoddard, Danielle Geary and Danielle Fuller each scored a goal for the Wolves. Abby O’Brien made 16 saves for HAC (12-1) and Emma Voorhees made 21 saves for Romulus. Naples 2, Midlakes 1 Skyler Matthews scored the game winner and Chloe Louthan-Green scored a goal for Naples. Myranda Donk scored the lone goal of the game for the Screaming Eagles. Page 2 of 2 - GIRLS VOLLEYBALL Gananda 3, Clyde-Savannah 1 The Blue Panthers won the first game 25-9, the third game 25-12 and the fourth game 25-11. Gananda is now 11-0 in league play. Alli Stark led the Blue Panthers with 20 assists and three aces. Riley Carr had 10 assists for the Golden Eagles and Cassie Carey had 13 digs. TUESDAY'S LATE RESULTS Cross Country At Mendon Ponds West, the Canandaigua Academy girls went 3-1 with wins over Brighton (21-34), Greece Athena (15-50) and Pittsford Sutherland (26-29). Rush-Henrietta beat CA (23-36). R-H's Sammie Watson placed first overall in 19:43, followed by CA freshmen Katie Cobos (19:53) and Clancy Rheude (20:03) in second and third, respectively. At Mendon Ponds West, the CA boys were 3-1 with wins over Rush-Henrietta (19-37), Greece Athena (17-46), and Pittsford Sutherland (25-31). Brighton defeated the Braves, 24-31. CA sophomore Scott Loforte finished second overall in 17:25, followed by Nate Barott in sixth (17:58) and Rickie Strong in seventh (18:02). Boys soccer Wayne 1, Newark 0 Gino Domicello scored for Wayne (9-0, 9-4) and Bryce Saba made two saves against the Reds (4-4-1, 4-8-1). Girls tennis Class D semifinals Naples 3, Lyons 2 Hanna Delgatto won at first singles, 7-5, 6-0, for the Big Green (8-2, 10-3). Naples earned its other points at first singles with the team of Avril King and Sam Spofford and the second doubles team of Payton Mann and Sienna Cervantes. Girls swimming Victor 113, Canandaigua 73 Natalie Zaravella won the 200 freestyle (1:57.54) and the 100 butterfly (:59.72) and also swam on the winning 200 medley and 400 free relay teams for Victor. Erin Norton won the diving event with a score of 296.10 and Mia Baggett won the 200 IM (2:17.91) and 100 breaststroke (1:10.29), and Abby Fenn won the 100 free (:55.41) and 100 back (1:02.96) for the Blue Devils. For Canandaigua, Kaitlyn Ringhoff won the 50 free (:25.46) and Sabrina Turek won the 500 free (5:26.02). By Messenger Post
